intro: Rubroshorea monticola, commonly known as the mountain redshorea, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright shrub form, with small, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom in the spring. Its flowers are typically tubular and attract various pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rubroshorea monticola is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
